title: Mirrors of Moscow
description: "Mirrors of Moscow" by Louise Bryant is a collection of journalistic sketches and profiles that examines the political and social atmosphere of revolutionary Russia. Published in 1923, the book provides an insightful, though subjective, portrayal of the key figures and events that shaped Soviet Russia in the aftermath of the 1917 Revolution. These figures includes Lenin, his subordinates, Jacob Peters, Lunacharsky, Kalinin, Kollontai, Trotsky, and Tchicherin, among others. Summary by Realfunghi

sections.title: Section 1 Foreword and Lenin and His Subordinates Part 1

Section 3 Jacob Peters, Fedore S. Dzerzhinsky and The Extraordinary Commission
Section 4 Anatol Vassilievitch Lunacharsky and Russian Culture
Section 5 Michael Ivanovitch Kalinin and The Peasants
Section 6 Madame Alexandra Kollontai and The Woman’s Movement
Section 7 Leon Trotsky, Soviet War Lord
Section 8 Enver Pasha and The Mohammedans
Section 9 Tikon and The Russian Church
Section 10 Tchicherin, Commissar for Foreign Affairs, and His Subordinates
Section 11 Maxim Litvinov, Assistant Commissar, Leonid Krassin and Subordinates
